description.narrative: REFs, d.v.s. Roma Education Funds, verksamhet syftar till att höja utbildningsnivån för romer i Europa. Sida avser ge kärnstöd till REF, vars verksamhet består i att genom projektbidrag, stipendier, forskning och påverkansarbete öka antalet romer som får kvalitativ utbildning från förskola ända upp till doktorsgrad. Sida avser finansiera verksamhet i alla de ODA-klassade länder som REF är verksamt i, d.v.s. i Albanien, Bosnien Herzegovina, Kosovo, Makedonien, Montenegro, Serbien, Turkiet, Moldavien och Ukraina. Sida har i flera år gett projektstöd till REF men bedömer nu att REF som organisation är mogen att hantera kärnstöd. REFs kapacitet att hantera medel på ett ansvarsfullt sätt samt organisationens förmåga att bedriva sin verksamhet gör att Sida bedömer den sammantagna risken för insatsen vara låg.

Roma Education Fund, REF, aims at increasing the level of Education of Europe's Roma population. Through the means of providing project grants, scholarships and through research and policy work REF contributes to increase the number of Roma achieving qualitative education at all levels in the education cycle, from pre-school to post-graduate studies.
Distribution: No country allocations in advance.

To close the gap in educational outcomes between Roma and non-Roma. REF contributes to SDG 4 - ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all. The REF strategic framework 2021 - 2030 sets out three strategic orientations: i) supporting individual beneficiaries,ii) utilizing/sensitizing education systems through advocating the needs and interests of Roma,iii) making REF a specialised organisation for the mobilization of the human potential of Roma and their contribution pedagogy.

description.narrative: In 2019, REF continued to implement its core activities through grants-giving and distribution of scholarships. REF issued a competitive call for grants in the Western Balkans. Out of 49 applications received, REF granted ten grants to grassroots organisations. Additionally, based on the invitation and ongoing Memorandum of Understanding, REF granted funds to the Ministry of Labor and Social Policy in North Macedonia and to the Central European University. For Romani students in tertiary education, REF provided 1,633 scholarships, out of which 340 were distributed to students from the Western Balkans. During the pandemic many of the Roma student were facing difficulties in studying remotely. During 2020 REF provided mentoring and tutoring to 4606 pupils as well as 1500 laptops and cases of 1100 Internet-access.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
